reviewText: Bought it for myself, but my kids, who are ages 8, 5, and 2, are also mesmerized by these videos.  John Ratzenberger (who played the character Norm from "Cheers"), keeps it entertaining.  Just waiting for the next series to come out now.
Love John Ratzenberger and loved this show when it was on.  And, it holds up.  We travel with him and learn as we go about where and how things are made.  Highly recommend.
These were so entertaining and informative. Very patriotic which I love. Wish John would do 20 more, I would buy them. Thanks for the great job, John!
Much ot it is outdated.  i have driven to a recommended location in Las Vegas and found that it had changed states.

Made in America is a great DVD series to watch by yourself or with a friend or spouse.  Each episode informs you how three different companies began and continue to thrive in the U.S.  The shows are only half-an-hour so they are perfect for watching while you're having a meal or just need a short break!

Exactly what I expected from John Ratzenberger. Interesting, entertaining, educational. Wish the show was still on TV. Fast service from the seller. I find myself buying more and more things from Amazon. An online store that I trust very much.

I use the series in my college business classes. Not everything is made in China and it is important that they know that.

The Prof.
This DVD is very entertaining and something for the entire family to watch.  Great job done by the producers & everyone else involved. !
Shows usually exhibit 3 to 4 different products in a half an hour.  doesn't go into a lot of depth but still very informative.

John Ratzenberger's Made in America (4 Disc Set) Ordered this set because we missed several of the segments included, and wish the program was still active. Product arrived well-packaged, and was delivered in a very timely manner. Quality is excellent, and we enjoy viewing the stories...even the repeats.

Having seen this show many times. I can tell the DVD is going to be great.

But I have to make a correction on the other guys review. John did NOT play Norm on Cheers, he was Cliff the mailman. And was brilliant in that role.

I am truly glad that we have people like him who go all around America and like he says "finding it's soul everywhere"
